info.title: Retail Procurement API
info.description: Retail procurement management API for submitting and viewing purchase orders, tracking price changes, and managing staff approvals. Compatible with Watsonx Orchestrate and Swagger UI.

get.description: Retrieve the complete history of purchase orders, including product_name, supplier, price, quantity, purchase_date, staff_in_charge, approver, price_category, latest_price_change information.

200.description:
Returns a list of orders. Each order includes:
- product_name: Name of the product
- supplier: Supplier name
- price: Price (float)
- quantity: Quantity (int)
- purchase_date: Date of purchase (YYYY-MM-DD)
- staff_in_charge: Staff responsible
- approver: Approver name
- price_category: Price change category ('Avoidance', 'No Saving', 'Reduction')
- latest_price_change: Price difference from previous order (string, '0' if not applicable)

post.description:
Submit details to add a new purchase order, including product, supplier, quantity, and staff information. 
        Calculates price change compared to previous order for the same product.

200.description:
Returns the created order with a status message or an error message if some field are stil missing.
Fields returned:
- message: Status message
- product_name: Name of the product
- supplier: Supplier name
- price: Price (float)
- quantity: Quantity (int)
- purchase_date: Date of purchase (YYYY-MM-DD)
- staff_in_charge: Staff responsible
- approver: Approver name
- price_category: Price change category ('Avoidance', 'No Saving', 'Reduction')
- latest_price_change: Price difference from previous order (string, '0' if not applicable) Downstream logic should extract and present only the fields relevant to the user’s query.

message.title: Message
message.description: Status message for the order. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

product_name.title: Product Name
product_name.description: Name of the product. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

supplier.title: Supplier
supplier.description: Supplier name. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

price.title: Price
price.description: Price of the product. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Quantity ordered. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

purchase_date.title: Purchase Date
purchase_date.description: Date of purchase (YYYY-MM-DD). Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

staff_in_charge.title: Staff In Charge
staff_in_charge.description: Staff responsible for the order. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

approver.title: Approver
approver.description: Name of the approver. Only extract and present from the user's query if relevant. Make sure it is not assumed N/A or None.

price_category.title: Price Category
price_category.description: Price change category: 'Avoidance' (price increased), 'No Saving' (price unchanged), 'Reduction' (price decreased).

latest_price_change.title: Latest Price Change
latest_price_change.description: Price difference from previous order (string, '0' if not applicable).
